column4: I'm trying to access my brother's computer, which is a Windows 7. But Ubuntu keeps asking for a password, which was not the case 2 days ago. I'm trying to enter my brother's password but it is not working either. Any hints?
with which protocol are you trying to access his computer?
I think it is smb. I access by clicking in Places > Network, than I try to enter SPOCK, which is my brother's computer name.
are you sure he haven't changed the rights of the shared folders?
Yes, but hey, it's a windows =P . I've figured the problem was happening when I couldn't use the printer anymore, since it is shared from his Windows
I will try to configure his Windows a little bit more
can you access his computer with another windows computer?
Hmm, thats a nice thing to try. Let me see
I can access my bro's computer with a Windows Vista, without password
yep. I guess this started happening after a Windows Update, but I can't be sure
how do you access it, from nautilus? Have you tried in diffrent ways?
I've tried from nautilus in two ways: by double clicking on my brother's computer and by typing his ip address smb://<ip address> . In both ways nautilus asks his password
if you write smb://<ip address>/<folder> then?
thanks for you help! I will lurker a bit more. Cya
no problem, hope you solve it! C ya
